page.title: 02Guildford Cathedral
page.content: The 160 foot high tower of {Guildford {Cathedral}with its golden angel stands on the summit of Stag Hill.It is visible from all parts of the town. Dedicated to the Holy Spirit, the Cathedral was designed by{Edward {Maufe.}Begun in 1936 the building was consecrated in 1961.The clay excavated when 800 piles were driven into the hill was made into the bricks for the exterior. The Somerset limestone interior is spacious, light and simple of decoration. Themes of blue colour, recalling the medieval wool industry and golden stags, recalling the Norman hunting grounds appear throughout, as do motifs of the flames of the Holy Spirit and the Dove of Peace. Stained glass windows, carvings and the distinctive kneelers commemorate local professions and groups, showing that this is a building for the people.
